definition: rightist elements
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
part/share/ingredient/component

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
(noun suffix)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: A small number of right- wingers may be drawn into the people's representative bodies.
sentences.chinese: 在民意机关中，还可吸收少数右派分子参加。

sentences.english: I think all these right wingers ought to thank Mr. Ran Yunfei .
sentences.chinese: 我想这些右派分子都应该感谢冉云飞先生。

sentences.english: Even a small number of right-wingers may be allowed to join the people's representative bodies.
sentences.chinese: 在民意机关中也可以容许少数右派分子参加。

sentences.english: The legislators who sat on the right side were referred to as the party of the Right, or rightists .
sentences.chinese: 而坐在右边的立法者则被称为右派，或者右派分子。

definition: (political) right/right wing/rightist
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
counterrevolutionary
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
anti-rightist/abbr. for 反右派鬥爭|反右派斗争[Fan3 you4 pai4 Dou4 zheng1]
rebel faction
stinking intellectual (contemptuous term for educated people during the Cultural Revolution)
bad element/bad egg
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
to suffer censure/denounced
Yao Wenyuan (1931-2005), one of the Gang of Four
reeducation through labor/laogai (prison camp)
Chen Boda (1904-1989), communist party theorist, interpreter of Maoism
Cultural Revolution (1966-1976)
